Fixed Description:
Customer Implementation Engineer

We’re seeking a Customer Implementation Engineer with at least 3 years of software engineering experience working with production systems. We’re looking for skilled software engineers who can independently solve complex technical problems and collaborate effectively with customers.

In this role, you will work directly with customer teams to understand their needs, support deployments, troubleshoot issues, and help ensure successful implementation of our solutions. Experience connecting different software systems, services, or tools so they work together effectively is important for success in this position.

This role includes a competitive salary range that will be shared with candidates early in the hiring process. It can be performed remotely, onsite, or in a hybrid arrangement depending on candidate preference and team needs. The position reports directly to the Engineering Manager.

Required and preferred qualifications will be clearly separated in the job posting to help candidates assess their alignment with the role. Applicants will receive confirmation within one week of applying, with interviews scheduled shortly thereafter.

This position also offers opportunities for professional development, mentorship, and advancement within the engineering organization.

Job Description:
Location: Remote

Role Overview:

As an International Coding Educator, you will deliver engaging online coding classes to students aged 5–18. Your teaching will cover both block-based and text-based programming, enabling students to build apps, websites, games, software, AI projects, and robotics solutions.

You will adapt your teaching style to match the learning patterns of different age groups, ensuring a fun, inspiring, and outcome-driven learning experience.

This role demands not only technical expertise but also a WOW factor in teaching – the ability to transform learning into a journey of curiosity, creativity, and innovation.
Summary: The job description is inspirational but lacks specificity in responsibilities and expectations. Key operational and structural details are missing, and some subjective language may unintentionally deter qualified applicants. Clarifying requirements and removing vague performance descriptors would improve inclusivity and usability.
Fixed Description:
Location: Remote

Role Overview:

As an International Coding Educator, you will deliver engaging online coding classes to students aged 5–18. You will teach programming using visual drag‑and‑drop tools and standard written programming languages, helping students create apps, websites, games, software, introductory artificial intelligence activities, and basic robotics projects.

You will adjust instructional approaches to meet the developmental needs and skill levels of students across different age groups, providing lessons that help learners build specific skills and complete age‑appropriate coding projects. Use engaging and effective teaching methods that support curiosity, creativity, and problem‑solving, demonstrating clear, student‑centered communication throughout.

Job Description:
Qualifications & Skills
US Accent Certified – ability to communicate in a clear, neutral, and engaging US accent.
5+ years of teaching experience in coding/programming to school or college students.
Strong command of both block-based and text-based programming.
Expertise in at least 3 of the following domains: App Development, Web Development, Game Development, Software Development, AI, Robotics.
Familiarity with educational tools, coding platforms, and online teaching technologies (Zoom, Google Classroom, Scratch, Replit, etc.).
Deep understanding of child & adolescent learning psychology.
Excellent communication, storytelling, and engagement skills.
Passionate about inspiring young minds and nurturing innovation.
What we offer
Opportunity to teach and inspire students across the globe.
Flexible, remote-first work environment.
Competitive compensation based on experience & expertise.
Access to innovative curriculum, teaching resources, and training.
Be part of a mission-driven edtech community that is shaping the future of education.
Role Objective-To plan, deliver, and manage high-quality technical training programs aligned with project objectives, ensuring 100% completion of training and placement targets, maximizing student engagement and success, driving core domain placements, maintaining adherence to lesson plans, and contributing proactively to student retention, academic excellence, and continuous domain knowledge upgradation. Responsibilities
Deliver training programs as per the project plan, ensuring 100% completion of planned student training modules.
Monitor and reduce dropout ratio, taking proactive measures to retain students through engagement and intervention.
Provide mentoring and academic support to students, assisting them with technical doubts and career guidance.
Maintain batch average attendance as per organizational benchmarks, ensuring student participation and engagement.
Regularly upgrade personal domain knowledge, staying current with industry trends, tools, and technologies.
Contribute to student placement efforts: track nomination-to-interview ratios, support placement preparation, and liaise with placement
Guide active students to complete their projects successfully, ensuring projects are industry-relevant and aligned with learning objectives.
Maintain high trainer utilization, effectively planning and delivering sessions to optimize time and resources.
Follow the training and upgrade plan, attending upskilling sessions, certifications, or internal workshops as required.
Ability to train trainers, teachers on the above skills
Ability to conduct TTT program online
At least intermediate proficiency in using online meeting platforms like Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, WebEx, Skype etc. and different meeting features like breakout rooms, polls, questions, whiteboard offered by at least one of these platforms
Should be comfortable driving day long online training sessions
Summary: The job description includes strong detail about responsibilities but contains several unclear expectations, undefined metrics, and internal jargon. It also features some exclusionary elements, such as requiring a US accent and vague intensive workload expectations. Clarifying requirements and removing bias would improve accessibility and inclusivity for a wider candidate pool.
Fixed Description:
Qualifications and Skills
• Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English with a neutral, easy-to-understand accent.  
• 5+ years of experience teaching coding or programming to school or college students.  
• Strong command of both block‑based and text‑based programming.  
• Demonstrated proficiency—through teaching experience, professional work, or a project portfolio—in at least three of the following areas: App Development, Web Development, Game Development, Software Development, AI, Robotics.  
• Familiarity with educational tools, coding platforms, and online teaching technologies (such as Zoom, Google Classroom, Scratch, Replit).  
• Deep understanding of child and adolescent learning psychology.  
• Excellent communication, storytelling, and engagement skills.  
• Committed to supporting student learning and encouraging creativity.  
• At least intermediate proficiency with online meeting platforms such as Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, WebEx, or Skype, including features like breakout rooms, polls, questions, and whiteboards.  
• Ability to conduct online Train‑the‑Trainer (TTT) programs.  
• Able to facilitate extended online training sessions with appropriate breaks as needed.

What We Offer
• Opportunity to teach and inspire students across the globe.  
• Flexible, remote‑first work environment.  
• Competitive compensation; a salary range or structured compensation details will be shared during the early stages of the hiring process.  
• Access to innovative curriculum, teaching resources, and training.  
• Be part of a mission‑driven edtech community shaping the future of education.  
• This role reports to the Training Manager or designated Program Lead.  
• Key qualifications will be marked as required or preferred during the interview or screening process.  
• Employment type (full‑time, part‑time, or contract) will be specified during the initial screening stage.  
• Work schedule and time‑zone expectations will be communicated in advance, including typical session durations and required availability windows.  
• Details about the application process and hiring timeline will be provided upon submission of your application.

Role Objective
To plan, deliver, and manage high‑quality technical training programs aligned with clearly defined project goals shared at the start of each assignment, working toward agreed‑upon training completion and placement goals established by the organization.

Responsibilities
• Deliver training programs as per the project plan, ensuring completion of planned student training modules.  
• Monitor and reduce dropout rates by taking proactive measures to maintain student engagement.  
• Provide mentoring and academic support to students, assisting with technical questions and career guidance.  
• Maintain batch attendance according to organizational benchmarks and promote consistent student participation.  
• Continuously update your subject knowledge to stay current with industry trends, tools, and technologies.  
• Contribute to placement efforts by monitoring student progress through the placement pipeline, including tracking how many nominated students advance to interviews, supporting placement preparation, and coordinating with the placement team.  
• Guide active students in successfully completing industry‑relevant projects aligned with learning objectives.  
• Effectively plan and deliver sessions to optimize your assigned training schedule.  
• Follow the training and upgrade plan, attending required upskilling sessions, certifications, or internal workshops.  
• Ability to train other trainers or teachers in the above skills.

Job Description:

At least 2-3 years of experience in conducting similar TTT programs for trainers. Exposure to corporate training will be an advantage
Well experienced in conducting online training and using features of online meeting platforms
Experience in student placements or working with placement teams is a plus.
Certified on any TTT programme to serve as an advantage
Education

Technical Skills

Summary: The job description contains strong technical detail but lacks clarity on expectations, responsibilities, and required versus preferred qualifications. Several acronyms and domain-specific terms are undefined, and key information such as compensation, reporting structure, and application process is missing. Overall, the posting may confuse candidates and limit the pool of qualified applicants.
Fixed Description:
Desired Profile  
Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field), with strong experience as a Technical Trainer in Java and Python.  
At least 2–3 years of experience conducting Train-the-Trainer (TTT) programs for trainers (required). Experience with corporate training is preferred.  
Well experienced in conducting online training and using features of online meeting platforms.  
Experience in student placements or working with placement teams is a plus.  
Certification in any TTT program is an advantage.

Education  
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, AI, data science, or a related field with strong coding experience.

Technical Skills  
Solid understanding of Transformer models, LLMs, fine-tuning, and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF).  
Strong coding ability in Python and familiarity with Jupyter, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.  
Hands-on experience with LangChain, AutoGPT, Hugging Face Transformers, OpenAI API, and similar tools.  
Familiarity with vector databases such as Pinecone, FAISS, and Weaviate, as well as Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines.

Instructional Skills  
Proven experience in technical training, curriculum development, or mentorship.  
Excellent communication and presentation skills.  
Ability to simplify complex topics for diverse audiences.

Nice-to-Have  
Certification in AI/ML (e.g., Google Cloud ML, Azure AI, DeepLearning.ai GenAI specialization).  
Experience with agent frameworks.  
Awareness of AI ethics, alignment, and responsible deployment.  
Experience deploying LLM-based applications to production environments.

Location  
Someone who can work from Hyderabad, Chennai, or Bangalore and is willing to travel occasionally based on project needs.
